item.title: A Beginner Guide to Hadoop: Unlocking the Power of Big Data
item.description: What is Hadoop? Hadoop is an open-source framework developed by the Apache Software Foundation, designed to store and process large datasets distributed across clusters of commodity hardware. It provides a scalable, reliable, and cost-effective solution for handling big data. Components of Hadoop Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS) At the core of Hadoop is the Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS), a distributed file system that stores data across multiple machines in a Hadoop cluster.
